docs.title: FSL
docs.description:
FSL is a comprehensive library of analysis tools for FMRI, MRI and diffusion brain imaging data. It runs on macOS (Intel and M1/M2/M3), Linux, and Windows via the Windows Subsystem for Linux, and is very easy to install. Most of the tools can be run both from the command line and as GUIs ("point-and-click" graphical user interfaces). To quote the relevant references for FSL tools you should look in the individual tools' manual pages, and also please reference one or more of the FSL overview papers:

M.W. Woolrich, S. Jbabdi, B. Patenaude, M. Chappell, S. Makni, T. Behrens, C. Beckmann, M. Jenkinson, S.M. Smith. Bayesian analysis of neuroimaging data in FSL. NeuroImage, 45:S173-86, 2009

S.M. Smith, M. Jenkinson, M.W. Woolrich, C.F. Beckmann, T.E.J. Behrens, H. Johansen-Berg, P.R. Bannister, M. De Luca, I. Drobnjak, D.E. Flitney, R. Niazy, J. Saunders, J. Vickers, Y. Zhang, N. De Stefano, J.M. Brady, and P.M. Matthews. Advances in functional and structural MR image analysis and implementation as FSL. NeuroImage, 23(S1):208-19, 2004

M. Jenkinson, C.F. Beckmann, T.E. Behrens, M.W. Woolrich, S.M. Smith. FSL. NeuroImage, 62:782-90, 2012

docs.title: Parameter Names File
docs.description: File containing the names of the model parameters

docs.title: Model Fit File
docs.description: The model fit output file

docs.title: Residuals File
docs.description: The residuals output file

docs.title: Model Extras File
docs.description: The model extras output file

docs.title: MVN File
docs.description: The MVN distributions output file

docs.title: Mean File
docs.description: The parameter means output file

docs.title: Standard Deviations File
docs.description: The parameter standard deviations output file

docs.title: Variances File
docs.description: The parameter variances output file

docs.title: Z-Stats File
docs.description: The parameter Zstats output file

docs.title: Noise Means File
docs.description: The noise means output file

docs.title: Noise Standard Deviations File
docs.description: The noise standard deviations output file

docs.title: Free Energy File
docs.description: The free energy output file
Fabber is a tool for model-based Bayesian analysis of time-series data
authors: FMRIB Analysis Group, University of Oxford

docs.title: Output Directory
docs.description: Directory for output files (including logfile)

docs.title: Inference Method
docs.description: Use this inference method

docs.title: Forward Model
docs.description: Use this forward model

docs.title: Data File
docs.description: Specify a single input data file

docs.title: Multiple Data Files
docs.description: Specify multiple data files for n=1, 2, 3...

docs.title: Data Order
docs.description: If multiple data files are specified, how they will be handled

docs.title: Mask File
docs.description: Mask file. Inference will only be performed where mask value > 0

docs.title: Masked Time Points
docs.description: List of masked time points, indexed from 1. These will be ignored in the parameter updates

docs.title: Supplemental Data
docs.description: 'Supplemental' timeseries data, required for some models

docs.title: Model Evaluation
docs.description: Evaluate model. Set to name of output required or blank for default output. Requires model configuration options, --evaluate-params and --evaluate-nt

docs.title: Evaluation Parameters
docs.description: List of parameter values for evaluation

docs.title: Number of Time Points
docs.description: Number of time points for evaluation

docs.title: Simple Output
docs.description: Instead of usual standard output, simply output series of lines each giving progress as percentage

docs.title: Overwrite Flag
docs.description: If set will overwrite existing output. If not set, new output directories will be created by appending '+' to the directory name

docs.title: Link to Latest Flag
docs.description: Try to create a link to the most recent output directory with the prefix _latest

docs.title: Load Models
docs.description: Load models dynamically from the specified filename, which should be a DLL/shared library

docs.title: Debug Flag
docs.description: Output large amounts of debug information. ONLY USE WITH VERY SMALL NUMBERS OF VOXELS
File containing additional options, one per line, in the same form as specified on the command line

docs.title: Options File
docs.description: Read options in option=value form from the specified file

docs.title: Options File
docs.description: File containing additional options, one per line, in the same form as specified on the command line

docs.title: Save Model Fit Flag
docs.description: Output the model prediction as a 4d volume

docs.title: Save Residuals Flag
docs.description: Output the residuals (difference between the data and the model prediction)

docs.title: Save Model Extras Flag
docs.description: Output any additional model-specific timeseries data

docs.title: Save MVN Flag
docs.description: Output the final MVN distributions

docs.title: Save Mean Flag
docs.description: Output the parameter means

docs.title: Save Standard Deviations Flag
docs.description: Output the parameter standard deviations

docs.title: Save Variances Flag
docs.description: Output the parameter variances

docs.title: Save Z-Stats Flag
docs.description: Output the parameter Z-stats

docs.title: Save Noise Means Flag
docs.description: Output the noise means. The noise distribution inferred is the precision of a Gaussian noise source

docs.title: Save Noise Standard Deviations Flag
docs.description: Output the noise standard deviations

docs.title: Save Free Energy Flag
docs.description: Output the free energy, if calculated

docs.title: Help Flag
docs.description: Print this usage method. If given with --method or --model, display relevant method/model usage information

docs.title: List Methods Flag
docs.description: List all known inference methods

docs.title: List Models Flag
docs.description: List all known forward models

docs.title: List Parameters Flag
docs.description: List model parameters (requires model configuration options to be given)

docs.title: Describe Parameters Flag
docs.description: Describe model parameters (name, description, units) - requires model configuration options to be given. Note that not all models provide parameter descriptions

docs.title: List Outputs Flag
docs.description: List additional model outputs (requires model configuration options to be given)

docs.title: Old Options File
docs.description: Read options in command line form from the specified file (DEPRECATED)
Fabber is a tool for model-based Bayesian analysis of time-series data
authors: FMRIB Analysis Group, University of Oxford
